results.title: Pre-operative care
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Care of the sick and injured”.
Demonstrates the method of preparing a patient both mentally and physically for an appendectomy operation. Shows the method of preparing the operative field for abdominal or bone operations.

results.title: Post operative care
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Care of the sick and injured”.
Describes how to make an anaesthetic bed and how to put a patient in bed after an operation with minimal movement. Describes how a patient must be watched and every reaction noted while regaining consciousness.

results.title: Isolation technique
results.creator_credit: United States. Dept. of the Navy and Willard Pictures
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Care of the sick and injured”.
Demonstrates how to perform medical aseptic techniques when caring for a patient with a communicable disease. Shows how to set up an isolation unit; how to organise the work; when and when not to wear the isolation gown and mask; how and when to wash the hands; how to remove and clean items used in the unit. Concludes with a short summary of basic principles to be observed when caring for a patient in isolation.
results.creator_credit_for_label: United States. Dept. of the Navy and Willard Pictures

results.title: Giving an enema
results.creator_credit: United States. Dept. of the Navy
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Care of the sick and injured”
Discusses two main types of enemas, retention and evacuant, and demonstrates the procedure for giving them. Emphasises the importance of after-care of the patient and sterilization of equipment.

results.title: Evening Care
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Care of the sick and injured”.
Stresses the obligation of each hospital corpsman is to be cheerful and to make each patient comfortable. Demonstrates the alcohol rub which will prevent pressure sores.

results.title: Catheterizing the male patient
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Care of the sick and injured”.
A United States Navy training film featuring instructive animations demonstrating male genitourinary function. Describes various ways of assisting the male bed patient to pass water when difficulty in doing so occurs. The last resort, catheterising, is illustrated in detail.
results.description:

results.title: Beds and appliances
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Care of the sick and injured”.
This film, produced by the U.S. Navy, demonstrates how to make and manipulate beds for the sick and injured (particularly those bedridden for extended periods of time) so that the patient’s comfort is increased and their recovery is thereby quickened. Demonstrates how to make a bunk as well as a bed in a ward so that the bedclothes do no need adjusting during the day, and also includes handy tips for materials which can be used to improvise elevations and inclines to vary a patient’s position in bed. No other credits available.

results.title: Bathing the bed patient
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Care of the sick and injured”.
Procedure for making a bed with a minimum of disturbance to the patient. Also demonstrates the proper method of washing the patient with as much comfort as posible.

results.title: Canoeing safely
results.creator_credit: Maurice Dybeck, Peter Halket and Explorer Films
results.brief_description:
Episode number 4 of Series “Canoecraft”.
Underlines some of the dangers which abound on almost every river and canal and shows ways of taking sensible precautions to avoid these dangers. Topics covered include life; hazards; paddling skills; an ‘H’ rescue; canoe buoyancy aids; weirs; capsize drill; stopper waves; emergency packs; bridges and a ‘T’ rescue.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Maurice Dybeck, Peter Halket and Explorer Films
